word: "MOTHER HAS NEVER LAID CLAIM TO VERBAL INSPIRATION, AND I DO NOT FIND THAT MY FATHER, OR ELDER BATES, ANDREWS, SMITH, OR WAGGONER, PUT FORTH THIS CLAIM. IF THERE WERE VERBAL INSPIRATION IN WRITING HER MANUSCRIPTS, WHY SHOULD THERE BE ON HER PART THE WORK OF ADDITION OR ADAPTATION? IT IS A FACT THAT MOTHER OFTEN TAKES ONE OF HER MANUSCRIPTS, AND GOES OVER IT THOUGHTFULLY, MAKING ADDITIONS THAT DEVELOP THE THOUGHT STILL FURTHER.
